data.title: Uttarakhand Van panchayat
data.meta_description: Uttarakhand Van panchayat - Download as a PDF or view online for free
data.text:
1. UTTARAKHAND VAN PANCHAYAT Presented By: Sandeep Prabhakar ID No-17352 M.Sc. Agroforestry

2. Content  History  Van panchayat  Van panchayat fund  Frame of van panchayat  Function of van panchayat  Powers of van panchayat  Microplan  Van panchayat rule 2005

3. History  1815-British arrived in Uttarakhand use forests as commercial resource.  1864-Established the Indian forest department  1878- forest act passed, transferred mountain forests into the control of forest department, imposed and banned forest fires.  1921- Kumaun forest grievance committee.  1927- Indian forest act.  1931- first van panchayat rules  1972, 1976, 2001, 2005- Van panchayat rules.

4. Van panchayat Van panchayat is self initiated forest protection group in Uttarakhand. Village communities of Uttarakhand have been involved in forest management and forest protection known as Van Panchayats (VPs). Van panchayat are a unique example of forestry in partnership with government and local people.

5. State govt. Of Uttarakhand Revenue deptt. Forest deptt. Sub divisional magistrate Divisional forest officer VAN PANCHAYAT Management committee Sarpanch Van panchayat leader User User User Application Investigation Approval

6.  The first government approved van panchayat was formed in 1921.  There are 12064 van panchayat managing 5.23 lakh hectares of forests in Uttarakhand.  Except U.S. Nagar and Haridwar, 11 district of uttrakhand have van panchayat.  Maximum No. Of Van panchayat in Pauri (2430) followed by Almora (2199) and Pithoragarh (1661).  Minimum No. Of Van panchayat is in Dehradun (205) followed by Nainital (496).

7. Sources of fund A panchayti forest fund shall be created for every van panchayat & the income from the following sources shall be deposited in it:  The sale of proceeds of forest produce  Government grants  Any other sources of revenue Van panchayat shall manage the panchayti forest fund under the overall control of DFO. the account shall be operated by the sarpanch.

8. Fund disbursed to van panchayat for afforestation and other activities by forest dept. has been Rs. 4.26 crore in 2016-17, Rs. 11.00 crore in 2015-16 and Rs. 15.61 crore in 2014-15. Government grants of van panchayat Referance:Times of India, Seema Sharma, Nov 21,2017

9. Function of van panchayat  To develop and protect forests.  To construct and fixed boundary and maintain them.  To ensure that there is no encroachment on van panchayat land.  To carry out the directives of the sub-divisional magistrate in developing and protecting forests.  20% of the area of the forest must be closed for grazing every year.  To distribution of forest produce amongst right holder in an equitable manner.

10. Uttarakhand  Total geographical area is 53483 sq km.  13 districts with 37999.60 sq km of forest (71.05% of total land area) and forest cover is 24495 sq km (45.80%).  In Uttrakhand established approximate 12089 Van panchayat, 6278 in Garhwal region and 5811 in Kumaun region.

11. Frame of Van panchayat At least more than 50% mature people have to agree for making van panchayat in their village and boundary of that village should touch the forest area (under the Uttarakhand forest dept.).

12. The members of van panchayat  In van panchayat 5-13 member elected by peoples.  election are held every five year.  One surpanch is elected from themselves.  At list one SC/ST member and one woman member should be elected to committee.  The number of member is depend on the number of households in village.

13. Financial power of van panchayat  They can sell grass, fallen twigs and stone slates.  They can sell tree up to value of Rs. 5000 with the approval of distt. Magistrate and DFO.  The income released from resin, timber and fees is distributed as- • Zila parisad is given 20% • Gram sabha is given 40% • the remaining is given to state forest deptt for maintenance and development of van panchayat rules.

14. The punitive power of van panchayat  They can levy fine up to Rs. 50 with the prior approval of the deputy commissioner, later revised up to Rs. 500.  They can seize cattle.  They can forfeit the weapons of the offender.

15. MICROPLAN- Van Panchayat to prepare a micro plan for the management & protection of panchayti forests for a period of 5 yr with the assistance of the DFO. The micro plan will be placed before the general meeting of all right holders for it approval before it is finally. DUTIES OF SARPANCH- the sarpanch shall be responsible for overall functioning of van panchayat, which include calling & presiding meeting, directing & managing the establishment, works & accounts. the sarpanch will have the power to incur expenditure up to Rs 1000/.

16. VAN PANCHAYAT RULES 2005 Rules 1- Full name, establishment and expansion of van panchayat. Rules 2- Definition Rules 3- Frame of van panchayat Rules 4- Notice related to issue and clime Rules 5- Appeal related to boundary of van panchayat and decision of issue and clime. Rules 6(A)- Right of user 6(B)- Duties of user Rules 7- Formation of common assembly and management committee

17. Rules 8- Appeal related to election Rules 9- Declaration of management committee Rules 10- Informed the forest deptt. about van panchayat and management committee. Rules 11- Management strategy Rules 12- Micro plan. Rules 13- Annual working strategy Rules 14- Working plan of management committee Rules 15- Working periods of member of management committee Rules 16- Meeting of management committee Rules 17- Elimination of sarpanch and other members Rules 18- Use of forest produce Rules 19- Duties of management committee Rule 20- Rights of management committee

18. Rule 21- Power to make byelaws Rule 22- Appointment of labours Rule 23- Maintained register Rule 24- Annual working report of management committee Rule 25- Duties of sarpanch Rule 26- Stand down of sarpanch Rule 27- Selection of another sarpanch within members Rule 28- Fund of van panchayat Rule 29- Management of fund of van panchayat Rule 30- Use of fund that is obtained from forest produce Rule 30(A)- Aforestation employment strategy Rule 31- Annual budget

19. Rule 32- Change over annual budget Rule 33- Account Rule 34- Examination of accountant Rule 35- Disposal objection related to exam of accountant Rule 36- information about Embezzlement (gaban) Rule 37- Investigation of embezzlement Rule 38- members or sarpanch are suspend Rule 39- suspension of members or sarpanch of management committee Rule 40- appeal against rule 38 & 39 Rule 41- Appointment of another sarpanch Rule 42- Name of temporary sarpanch Rule 43- Suspension, disruption and encrochment of management committee Rule 44- Appeal against rule 43

20. Rule 45- Formation of new temporary management committee Rule 46- Reorganisation of management committee Rule 47- recovery of bill or dues of management committee Rule 48- Evaluation of expense amount of management committee by forest deptt. Rule 49- power of DFO Rule 50- evaluation of working activities of management committee by officers Rule 51- Evaluation of working activities of management committee by MLA & Saansad Rule 52- Formation of regional advisory committee Rule 53- formation of district advisory committee

21. Rule 54- Formation of state level advisory committee Rule 55- Selection of regional and district coordinator Rule 56- Removal of regional and district coordinator through no confidence motion Rule 57- Duties of regional and district advisory committee Rule 58- all the van panchayat should follow the earlier implemented rules of schedule district act 1974/ kumaun panchayat forest rules/ tehri state province panchayati legislation number 1, 1938/ 1976 or declared under panchayati van rules 2001

22. Pauri Garhwal van panchayat Record Sr no Block name Total van panchayat Area in acre 1 KOTDWAR 194 2165.582 2 KALJIKHAL 193 2251.499 3 PAURI 150 2152.635 4 PABO 145 1952.881 5 THALISAIN 168 7605.981 6 BIRONKHAL 184 3731.027 7 DWARIKHAL 158 2741.251 8 DUGADDA 159 4035.020 9 JAHRIKHAL 174 3575.568 10 EKESHWAR 137 2341.725 11 RIKHNIKHAL 149 7431.920 12 YAMESHWAR 197 3847.185 13 NAINIDANDA 220 5996.163 14 POKHRA 123 1648.733 15 KHIRSHU 80 1402.972 Total 2431 52880.163
